subject: AccuWeather.com Alert(tm) Advisory  (avcavc)
body:
AccuWeather.com Alert[TM]






















 







							Severe Watches and Warnings for BEVERLY HILLS 













LOXCFWLOX
WHUS46 KLOX 140039
CFWLOX

COASTAL HAZARD MESSAGE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LOS ANGELES/OXNARD CA
539 PM PDT FRI APR 13 2007

..HIGH SURF CONTINUES ON SOUTHWEST FACING BEACHES OF SOUTHWEST
CALIFORNIA...

A SOMEWHAT LARGE WESTERLY SWELL GENERATED BY STRONG NORTHWEST FLOW
CONTINUES OVER THE COASTAL WATERS. IN ADDITION...THE MODERATE
SOUTHERLY SWELL FROM A PREVIOUS STORM IN THE SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE
CONTINUES TO IMPACT THE AREA. THIS COMBINATION OF WESTERLY AND
SOUTHERLY SWELLS WILL PRODUCE HIGH SURF ALONG THE EXPOSED SOUTHWEST
FACING BEACHES OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA AS WELL AS HIGH RIP CURRENT
RISK THROUGH TONIGHT.

CAZ040-041-140500-
/O.CON.KLOX.SU.Y.0006.000000T0000Z-070414T0500Z/
VENTURA COUNTY COAST-
LOS ANGELES COUNTY COAST INCLUDING DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES-
539 PM PDT FRI APR 13 2007

..HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS
EVENING...

A HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING.

FIVE TO SEVEN FOOT BREAKERS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AT THE BEACHES
OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES...ESPECIALLY AT FAVORABLY
EXPOSED SOUTHWEST FACING BEACHES...THROUGH THIS EVENING. WHILE
THE GUSTY WINDS DRIVING THIS SWELL HAVE BEGUN TO DIMINISH...
CONDITIONS ARE STILL EXPECTED TO BE HAZARDOUS THROUGH THIS
EVENING. THE COMBINATION OF HIGH SURF WITH THE MIXED NORTHWEST AND
SOUTH SWELL WILL ALSO CONTINUE TO PRODUCE DANGEROUS RIP CURRENTS
ALONG THE BEACHES OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES. SURF WILL
SUBSIDE LATER THIS EVENING.

$$

CAZ034-035-140500-
/O.CON.KLOX.CF.S.0004.000000T0000Z-070414T0500Z/
SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNTY CENTRAL COAST-
SANTA BARBARA COUNTY CENTRAL COAST-
539 PM PDT FRI APR 13 2007

..ABOVE NORMAL SURF EXPECTED ALONG THE CENTRAL COAST...

SEVEN TO NINE FOOT BREAKERS ARE EXPECTED ALONG THE CENTRAL CALIFORNIA
COAST THROUGH THIS EVENING...WITH LOCAL SETS TO TEN FEET ALONG FAVORABLY
EXPOSED WEST FACING BEACHES. WHILE THE PERIOD OF THESE WAVES IS ONLY
NEAR TWELVE SECONDS...A STRONG NORTHWEST SWELL DRIVEN BY NORTHWEST
WINDS IS STILL EXPECTED TO IMPACT THE COASTLINE THROUGH THE
EVENING. SURF WILL SUBSIDE LATER THIS EVENING.

$$
